answers.answer: Hi!Well, oats contain gluten, so that can explain palpitations after you eat oats. Other than that many so called gluten free products contain hidden gluten in form of oats, barley, wheat, all purpose flour etc. So look out for that. Also you may have diabetes, so that needs to be ruled out. A food challenge test should be done to see whether you have food sensitivities or not. Take care!

Hi Doctor.I forgot to mention that my gut also gets swollen & as hard as nails in the solar plexus area. It is only relieved by passing gas, but it doesnt always happen so can become very uncomfortable!

question: I wonder if it is possible that my IBS problem involving gluten not only affects the gut, but also heartbeats?  I have been eating quick oats for a while, in the belief that oats dont contain gluten, but maybe 15 mins after breakfast I start to get rapid heartbeat & a strange fluttering feeling in the stomach, + wanting to sleep.  I have substituted puffed millet for 2 days & the symptoms dont happen, but flavoured gluten free rice biscuits bring it on at lunch time!
title: palpitations after certain foods
